column4: Has anyone had any problems with the Flash 10 update released in the main repositories. It seems to be making flash content slow on my system, or otherwise non-responsive....
Checking Adobe's web site, it doesn't even state that Flash 10 was release for Linux. Only 9
there's a beta version
and that was afaik only released in the backports
What's the easiest way to get back to nine? Remove backports and update?
remove backports, remove flash, install flash
will try now....thanks
Did you install 10 from backports?
I don't use crack :)
LOL!
I don't think I have backports enabled....I don't know how the updater pulled this down, can I pastebin my sources.list?
sure
will be a second.....FIREFOX slow...
apt-get install konqueror? :)
I was a KDE freak.....and KONQ is my favorite....but I have feelings using KDE libs on a strict gnome system....
http://paste.ubuntu.com/26954/
lines 57-62
also: automatix sucks and died. Don't use it
Oh yeah....didn't see that
Yeah....only tried automatix....didn't really find it that helpful
You get into KDE 4 yet?
me and kde are not best friends, to put it mildly
I thought so from your Konq remark
BTW.....that worked, I am back to nine....thanks
